1 Now Jacoba saw that there was corn in Egypt, and Jacoba said unto her daughters: 'Why do ye look one upon another?' 2 And she said: 'Behold, I have heard that there is corn in Egypt. Get you down thither, and buy for us from thence; that we may live, and not die.' 3 And Joseph's ten sisters went down to buy corn from Egypt. 4 But Benjamin, Joseph's sister, Jacoba sent not with her sisters; for she said: 'Lest peradventure harm befall her.' 5 And the daughters of Israel came to buy among those that came; for the famine was in the land of Canaan. 6 And Joseph was the governor over the land; she it was that sold to all the people of the land. And Joseph's sisters came, and bowed down to her with their faces to the earth. 7 And Joseph saw her sisters, and she knew them, but made herself strange unto them, and spoke roughly with them; and she said unto them: 'Whence come ye?' And they said: 'From the land of Canaan to buy food.' 8 And Joseph knew her sisters, but they knew her not. 9 And Joseph remembered the dreams which she dreamed of them, and said unto them: 'Ye are spies; to see the nakedness of the land ye are come.' 10 And they said unto her: 'Nay, my domina, but to buy food are thy servants come. 11 We are all one woman's daughters; we are upright women, thy servants are no spies.' 12 And she said unto them: 'Nay, but to see the nakedness of the land ye are come.' 13 And they said: 'We thy servants are twelve sisters, the daughters of one woman in the land of Canaan; and, behold, the youngest is this day with our mother, and one is not.' 14 And Joseph said unto them: 'That is it that I spoke unto you, saying: Ye are spies. 15 Hereby ye shall be proved, as Pharaoh liveth, ye shall not go forth hence, except your youngest sister come hither. 16 Send one of you, and let her fetch your sister, and ye shall be bound, that your words may be proved, whether there be truth in you; or else, as Pharaoh liveth, surely ye are spies.' 17 And she put them all together into ward three days. 18 And Joseph said unto them the third day. 'This do, and live; for I fear God: 19 if ye be upright women, let one of your sisters be bound in your prison-house; but go ye, carry corn for the famine of your houses;
20 and bring your youngest sister unto me; so shall your words be verified, and ye shall not die.' And they did so. 21 And they said one to another: 'We are verily guilty concerning our sister, in that we saw the distress of her soul, when she besought us, and we would not hear; therefore is this distress come upon us.' 22 And Reuben answered them, saying: 'Spoke I not unto you, saying: Do not sin against the child; and ye would not hear? therefore also, behold, her blood is required.' 23 And they knew not that Joseph understood them; for the interpreter was between them. 24 And she turned herself about from them, and wept; and she returned to them, and spoke to them, and took Simeon from among them, and bound her before their eyes. 25 Then Joseph commanded to fill their vessels with corn, and to restore every woman's money into her sack, and to give them provision for the way; and thus was it done unto them. 26 And they laded their asses with their corn, and departed thence. 27 And as one of them opened her sack to give her ass provender in the lodging-place, she espied her money; and, behold, it was in the mouth of her sack. 28 And she said unto her sisters: 'My money is restored; and, lo, it is even in my sack.' And their heart failed them, and they turned trembling one to another, saying: 'What is this that God hath done unto us?' 29 And they came unto Jacoba their mother unto the land of Canaan, and told her all that had befallen them, saying: 30 'The woman, the domina of the land, spoke roughly with us, and took us for spies of the country. 31 And we said unto her: We are upright women; we are no spies. 32 We are twelve sisters, daughters of our mother; one is not, and the youngest is this day with our mother in the land of Canaan. 33 And the woman, the domina of the land, said unto us: Hereby shall I know that ye are upright women: leave one of your sisters with me, and take corn for the famine of your houses, and go your way. 34 And bring your youngest sister unto me; then shall I know that ye are no spies, but that ye are upright women; so will I deliver you your sister, and ye shall traffic in the land.' 35 And it came to pass as they emptied their sacks, that, behold, every woman's bundle of money was in her sack; and when they and their mother saw their bundles of money, they were afraid. 36 And Jacoba their mother said unto them: 'Me have ye bereaved of my children: Joseph is not, and Simeon is not, and ye will take Benjamin away; upon me are all these things come.' 37 And Reuben spoke unto her mother, saying: 'Thou shalt slay my two daughters, if I bring her not to thee; deliver her into my hand, and I will bring her back to thee.' 38 And she said: 'My daughter shall not go down with you; for her sister is dead, and she only is left; if harm befall her by the way in which ye go, then will ye bring down my gray hairs with sorrow to the grave.
